name: Lettuce
description: The lettuce is a very popular vegetable which is cultivated for its large leaves; in some cases, these are pressed forming more or less compact core or heart. There are many varieties of this vegetable, and their number increases every year.

plantInstructions.title: Choose the lettuce variety
plantInstructions.description: The first thing to do is to choose which type of lettuce you are going to grow, which can be determined or undetermined. While determinate lettuce have a compact plant, and limited growth, ideal for pots, indeterminate lettuce grow continuously and need to be pruned periodically.

plantInstructions.title: Sowe the lettuce
plantInstructions.description: lettuce should be sown from winter onwards, and should be planted in a protected place, such as the interior of the house or in a greenhouse, preferably in a heated seedbed. The seeds germinate in 7-10 days.
plantInstructions.photoDescription: Small lettuce plants planted in indoor pots

plantInstructions.title: Transplanting the lettuce
plantInstructions.description: About two months after planting, the tomatoes should be transplanted to a place where the plants will be more separated, and with fertilizer with many nutrients.
plantInstructions.photoDescription: Transplanting a lettuce plant from a pot to the ground

plantInstructions.title: Harvesting the lettuce
plantInstructions.description: About 4-5 months after transplanting, the lettuce will be ready to be harvested.
